text:
Hi Matias !
Thanks for responding. We are facing two issues, one is what Selva D explained in his message, another issue is in the modules where HubDB table row are used as a fields. So we are struggling to push those modules file since the table row in sandbox server doesn’t exist. Do you have any workaround on this ?

Don’t use a default row in the module. Then you don’t have an issue with it not finding the specific row.
Set up the module afterwards with the right row in your sandbox portal, for testing.
This way you have the possibility to test the module in the sandbox portal, and you don’t get an error because you don’t have a default row id (which doesn’t exist) attached to the module.
When we choose HubDB row, we have to select one table field. It is mandatory. Thus how it was designed in HubSpot Modules.

Reminder: Don’t forget to keep your HubSpot CLI up to date to ensure you have the latest CLI features, bug/usability fixes and performance improvements. • <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli#upgrade|How to upgrade your CLI to the latest version>.
